result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $350.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit and balance to be paid FORTHWITH or serve 3 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencement until 11-30-2015. If defendant has a valid D.L., he can serve sentence on ES.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of MOTION HEARING commencing SEPTEMBER 11, 2015 received and filed. (44 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to COLIN MCGINN  819 N 6TH ST. 9TH FLOOR  MILWAUKEE, WI 53203.

Defendant Jeremy D Kelly in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 15 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 11-30-15. If defendant has a valid D.L. he can serve sentence on ES. 

Fine of $350.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit and balance  to be paid FORTHWITH  or serve 3 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy D Kelly in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/2/15 @ 1:30pm
